snippet: Major League Baseball Advanced Media will pay the N.H.L. $100 million annually for the right to operate the N.H.L.’s website as well as the league’s television and streaming services.
abstract: Major League Baseball Advanced Media strikes unusual deal with National Hockey League, agreeing to pay league $100 million annually to operate NHL.com website beginning in 2016 and develop new digital products for the NHL; as part of six-year deal, NHL Network will move into MLB Network's headquarters and studio in Secaucus, NJ.
lead_paragraph: Major League Baseball Advanced Media will pay the N.H.L. $100 million annually for the right to operate the N.H.L.’s website as well as the league’s television and streaming services.

headline.main: M.L.B. Advanced Media Joins With N.H.L. in Unusual Intersport Deal
